title: Wisconsin recall election: Message at war with itself
content:
Barrett 's contradicting message explains why he 's scrambling in the recall against Walker . Recall message at war with itself
MILWAUKEE — At stop after stop , from Baraboo to Green Bay , Tom Barrett calmly and patiently explains to voters that he ’ s the guy who can end Wisconsin ’ s bitter civil war .
But that typically comes just after he delivers a blistering tirade against Scott Walker .
It ’ s a message at war with itself , which helps explain why Barrett is scrambling in the final days of his campaign to unseat the Republican governor . Barrett faces other tough obstacles , of course — he ’ s been badly outspent and trails Walker in recent polls — but the inherent contradictions in his stump speech make it difficult for the Milwaukee mayor to persuade the small pool of voters who tell pollsters they are still undecided .
“ They ’ re floundering for something at the tail end here to resonate and he keeps going back to this civil war stuff , ” said state Senate Majority Leader Scott Fitzgerald , a Republican facing his own recall election next week . “ Part of his message just continues to be ‘ I ’ m going to make everything better in the end , ’ ” but “ there ’ s still going to be some divisiveness after the recalls are over . ”
Indeed , in stops across Wisconsin , Barrett has leaned hard into the idea that Walker sparked a civil war in the state for purely partisan purposes . He has accused the governor of fudging job growth numbers to make himself look better , of hiding emails in a criminal probe and doing the bidding of out-of-state billionaires . He also sunk his teeth in during the two televised debates and is running ads hammering Walker on the criminal investigation surrounding his former aides .
Walker “ has divided this state unlike it ’ s ever been divided before , ” Barrett said Tuesday in Green Bay .
Wisconsin voters “ know there is something wrong with this governor , with all the ethical issues that are out there , with all the truth issues that are out there , ” he said .
Meanwhile , Barrett insists it will be different under his regime .
“ I ’ m going to be a governor who will restore integrity to this job , ” Barrett told supporters in Wisconsin Rapids . “ I will bring this state together ; I will heal the wounds . ”
But the smash-mouth attacks make it hard to imagine Barrett as a unifying figure , a point Republicans have seized on .
Republican National Committee Chairman Reince Priebus called the strategy a “ hypocritical line of attack . ”
“ Tom Barrett continues to run a harshly negative and divisive campaign because he knows he can ’ t run on his record , ” Priebus told ███ in a statement . “ Wisconsinites see that Governor Walker ’ s reforms are working and an election that was billed a referendum on collective bargaining has spiraled into Barrett slinging mud while he struggles to gain traction with Wisconsinites . ”
